If Statements

If statements can be used as expressions or statements. They can also be used for pattern matching, all with a similar syntax.

v := 1 if v is not 1 ( print "nope" ) else ( print "yep" ) -- If as a statement if v is ( 0 => print "nope" 1 => print "yep" => print "defintely nope" ) -- If as an expression msg := if v is ( 0 => return "nope" 1 => return "yep" => return "defintely nope" ) print(msg) v = 69 if v is ( 0 => ( v += 1 print "yep" ) 1 => print "yep" => print "defintely nope" )
